concise_definition: v. 推, 推动, 勉强, 催促

definitions.explanation_en: To apply physical force against something in order to move it away from oneself or in a particular direction.
definitions.explanation_cn: 对某物施加物理力量，使其远离自己或朝特定方向移动。
definitions.example_en: He pushes the door open with his shoulder.

definitions.explanation_en: To urge or pressure someone to do something, often persistently or forcefully.
definitions.explanation_cn: 持续或强烈地敦促或施压某人做某事。
definitions.example_en: Her manager pushes her to meet the quarterly targets.
definitions.example_cn: 她的经理不断催促她完成季度目标。

definitions.explanation_en: To promote or advocate for something aggressively, especially in a commercial or political context.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在商业或政治语境中积极推广或倡导某事物。
definitions.example_en: The company pushes its new product through social media ads.
definitions.example_cn: 该公司通过社交媒体广告大力推广其新产品。

definitions.explanation_en: To force or extend something beyond its normal limits or boundaries, often metaphorically.
definitions.explanation_cn: 比喻性地将某事物强行推至其正常极限或边界之外。
definitions.example_en: She pushes herself to the limit during every training session.
definitions.example_cn: 她在每次训练中都逼自己达到极限。

comparison.analysis: “Shove” (猛推) 强调突然、粗暴或用力的推的动作，通常带有情绪色彩或身体冲突感，比 “push” 更具侵略性和短暂性。而 “pushes” 可以是温和、持续或策略性的推动，适用范围更广。
“Encourage” (鼓励) 指通过支持、激励或正面引导促使某人行动，语气积极且非强制。而 “pushes” 常带有压力、强迫或紧迫感，可能引起抵触情绪，语义强度更高。
“Propel” (推动) 更正式，常用于描述由外力或机制驱动的运动，如火箭推进、潮流推动社会变革，强调动力来源。而 “pushes” 更口语化，可指直接的身体接触或抽象的施压，适用场景更日常化。
